docs.snippet: Winning in the seventh round of the international chess masters tournament yesterday, Hector Rossetto of Argentina and Miguel Czerniak of Palestine remained at the top among eighteen competitors, according to a report received from Mar del Plata.
docs.lead_paragraph: Winning in the seventh round of the international chess masters tournament yesterday, Hector Rossetto of Argentina and Miguel Czerniak of Palestine remained at the top among eighteen competitors, according to a report received from Mar del Plata.

headline.main: ROSSETTO DEFEATS CRUZ IN 32 MOVES; Keeps Argentine Chess Lead -Czerniak Wins From Martin -- Lasker Test Adjourned

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 23 -Forty-two countries today unanimously adopted the international wheat agreement, described as a "trading instrument" to make possible "planned production and organized marketing of wheat throughout the world."
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 23 -Forty-two countries today unanimously adopted the international wheat agreement, described as a "trading instrument" to make possible "planned production and organized marketing of wheat throughout the world."

headline.main: 42 NATIONS ADOPT WHEAT AGREEMENT; Export and Import Quotas Set for 456,283,386 Bushels for Each of Four Years

byline.original: By BESS FURMANSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Erich Eliskases of Austria, last year's victor in the annual chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, triumphed in the eighth round of the current competition at the South American resort yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Erich Eliskases of Austria, last year's victor in the annual chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, triumphed in the eighth round of the current competition at the South American resort yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.

docs.snippet: Of nine games scheduled for the ninth round of the international masters' chess tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday only two were decided, according to a report received from Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Of nine games scheduled for the ninth round of the international masters' chess tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday only two were decided, according to a report received from Argentina.

headline.main: ROSSETTO HOLDS LEAD IN CHESS TOURNAMENT

docs.snippet: With a defeat of Arturito Pomar of Spain in the tenth round, yesterday, Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires strengthened his hold upon first place in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report received from...
docs.lead_paragraph: With a defeat of Arturito Pomar of Spain in the tenth round, yesterday, Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires strengthened his hold upon first place in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report received from Argentina.

headline.main: ROSSETTO VICTOR IN MASTERS CHESS; Adds to Lead in Tenth Round With Victory Over Pomar -Guimard Takes Fourth

docs.snippet: MADAME DE STAEL'S indictment of travel as "the saddest of pleasures" is often echoed by the nineteenth-century "rediscoverers" of southern South America, on whose writings Mr. Jones, an Associate Professor of History at the University of Minnesota,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MADAME DE STAEL'S indictment of travel as "the saddest of pleasures" is often echoed by the nineteenth-century "rediscoverers" of southern South America, on whose writings Mr. Jones, an Associate Professor of History at the University of Minnesota, has based his book.
docs.abstract: Jones, T B: South America Rediscovered

headline.main: Out of the South American Past; SOUTH AMERICA REDISCOVERED. By Tom B. Jones. 285 pp. Minneapolis: The University of Minnesota Press. $4.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS -- The United Nations received the go-ahead signal last week to continue its efforts to reduce passport restrictions, liberalize frontier and customs formalities and generally assist the free movement of tourist traffic.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS -- The United Nations received the go-ahead signal last week to continue its efforts to reduce passport restrictions, liberalize frontier and customs formalities and generally assist the free movement of tourist traffic.

headline.main: U. N. AIDING TOURISM; Cites Progress on Easing Frontier Formalities

docs.snippet: Commercial selling of spot sterling last Friday depressed the rate to $4.03 1/16, lowest in a month, and was easily the most surprising incident of the week in the foreign exchanges.
docs.lead_paragraph: Commercial selling of spot sterling last Friday depressed the rate to $4.03 1/16, lowest in a month, and was easily the most surprising incident of the week in the foreign exchanges.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended March 25, 1949

docs.snippet: Hector Rossetto held first place, with Carlos Guimard second after twenty-one adjourned games from seven of the rounds in the international chess tournament at Mar del Plata had been played off yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hector Rossetto held first place, with Carlos Guimard second after twenty-one adjourned games from seven of the rounds in the international chess tournament at Mar del Plata had been played off yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: LASKER SET BACK IN MASTERS PLAY; Loses Five Adjourned Chess Games at Mar del Plata -- Rossetto in Front
